results.headline: Review: ‘Allegiant’ Diverges as the End Nears
results.summary_short: “Allegiant,” the first part of the “Divergent” series finale, takes moviegoers to the creepy confines of the Bureau of Genetic Welfare.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Allegiant

results.headline: Review: ‘Fireworks Wednesday,’ a Domestic Drama From Iran
results.summary_short: Asghar Farhadi’s film, set during the boisterous New Year celebrations in Tehran, dissects the imploding marriage of an affluent couple.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Fireworks Wednesday

results.headline: Review: ‘Miracles From Heaven,’ Starring Jennifer Garner as the Mother of a Sick Child
results.summary_short: This deus-ex-machina tale, based on Christy Beam’s memoir, centers on a family whose faith is tested by a daughter’s illness.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Miracles From Heaven

results.headline: Review: ‘The Young Messiah’ Depicts Jesus as a Boy Discovering His Powers
results.summary_short: Cyrus Nowrasteh’s film hits some New Testament basics as it depicts the flight of Joseph, Mary and their son from Alexandria, Egypt, to Nazareth and eventually to Jerusalem.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Young Messiah

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Perfect Match,’ Weddings, Babies and One Bachelor Holdout
results.summary_short: Bille Woodruff’s circle-of-friends romantic comedy puts a commitment-phobic Los Angeles talent agent in the path of a ravishing mystery woman.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Perfect Match

results.headline: Review: ‘Marguerite,’ a Screeching Diva Clinging to Her Operatic Dream
results.summary_short: Xavier Giannoli’s comedy, inspired by the life of the talentless American socialite Florence Foster Jenkins, stars Catherine Frot as an aspiring singer.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Marguerite

results.headline: Review: ‘Boom Bust Boom,’ a Pythonesque Look at Financial Crashes
results.summary_short: This film by Terry Jones, formerly of Monty Python, explores the 2008 financial collapse and the possibility of more crashes through animation, puppetry and interviews with economists.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Boom Bust Boom

results.headline: Review: ‘10 Cloverfield Lane’ Houses a Survivalist, His Captive and Jolts
results.summary_short: J.J. Abrams produced but did not direct this thriller, which is only slightly connected to his “Cloverfield” (2008) and stars Mary Elizabeth Winstead.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of 10 Cloverfield Lane

results.headline: Review: ‘Eye in the Sky,’ Drone Precision vs. Human Failings
results.summary_short: Gavin Hood’s movie is a riveting thriller — and often a grim, suspenseful farce — about drone warfare and its perils.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Eye in the Sky

results.headline: Review: Tastes of Los Angeles in ‘City of Gold’
results.summary_short: Laura Gabbert’s documentary follows the food critic Jonathan Gold in his pursuit of excellence, which can lead to a taco truck or a high-end restaurant.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of City of Gold

results.headline: Review: In ‘Me Him Her,’ Late-20-Somethings Emerge From Life’s Confusion
results.summary_short: A loose indie comedy, this feature debut from Max Landis shows the mark of the 1985 cult classic “Into the Night,” made by his father, John Landis.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Me Him Her

results.headline: Review: ‘Creative Control,’ a Satire of Gadget-Driven Reality
results.summary_short: Benjamin Dickinson’s sophomore feature stars Mr. Dickinson as a stressed-out adman, an unprepossessing antihero with no control at all.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Creative Control

results.headline: Review: In Julie Delpy’s ‘Lolo,’ a Teenager Tries to Sabotage His Mother’s Romance
results.summary_short: Ms. Delpy plays an indulgent divorced parent whose chance at happiness is threatened by her spoiled and scheming son.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Lolo

results.headline: Review: In ‘About Scout,’ a Young Woman Searches for Her Sister
results.summary_short: Scout recruits a traveling companion from a psychiatric care center to search for her younger sister, who has been taken by their absentee father.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of About Scout

results.headline: Review: ‘The Brothers Grimsby’: From Sacha, With Love
results.summary_short: Sacha Baron Cohen returns with a movie about two brothers — a sleek superspy and a bumbling fool — who battle a global crime syndicate.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Brothers Grimsby

results.headline: Review: ‘Hyena Road’ Follows a Sniper Team in Afghanistan
results.summary_short: Paul Gross’s Canadian war film begins with the killing of a Taliban rebel by coalition forces.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hyena Road

results.headline: Review: ‘Rise of the Legend,’ a Kung Fu Period Film
results.summary_short: In 19th-century Guangzhou, two friends who have trained together, and pine for the same woman, are on opposite sides of a battle.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Rise of the Legend

results.headline: Review: Christopher Plummer Searches for a Nazi in ‘Remember’
results.summary_short: In Atom Egoyan’s psychological thriller, two men realize they were both at Auschwitz and plan revenge against a camp official.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Remember

results.headline: Review: ‘Hello, My Name Is Doris,’ About an Older Woman’s Love for a Much Younger Man
results.summary_short: A frumpy, lower-middle-class woman in her 60s suddenly finds herself desired, which leads to a ferocious awakening.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hello, My Name Is Doris

results.headline: Review: ‘Here Come the Videofreex,’ Revolution via the Portapak
results.summary_short: This concise and informative documentary follows the early adopters of a lightweight record-playback model by Sony in 1968.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Here Come the Videofreex
